greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n!*n^n.
comment: a(n) is the product of first n terms of an arithmetic progression with first term n and common difference n. E.g. a(3) = 3*6*9 = 162. - _Amarnath Murthy_, Sep 20 2003
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100 (corrected by Michel Marcus, Jan 19 2019)
formula: a(n) = [x^n] 1/(1 - n*x/(1 - n*x/(1 - 2*n*x/(1 - 2*n*x/(1 - 3*n*x/(1 - 3*n*x/(1 - ...))))))), a continued fraction. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 20 2017
xref: Cf. A053042, A036679, A055775. - _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jan 15 2009
results.author: Lorenzo Fortunato (fortunat(AT)pd.infn.it), Jun 19 2001
